Posts.Content: joyner1963 wrote: Hello everyone, I have just found a fantastic prescription for nausea after chemo. My tretment of Adryamiacin, Taxotere & Cytoxan began on 10/29/09. I've had 4 tretments total and even though they gave me ALL the anti-nausea meds they could give me, nothing worked. I started researching on line and found  a transdermal patch called Sansuco. The medication in the patch is Granisetron, which is also used in IV for nausea.  Anyway, I put the thing on the morning of my chemo and I experienced NO nausea for the first time ever.   None during the week following and have had no queaziness either.  This patch was a life saver for me. The web site is www.sansuco.com.    It  has meant so much for me to be able to recover from treatment so quickly this time.    I hope the above info can help other women as well. God Bless, Georgia Joyner Dx 9/25/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage II, Grade 2, 5/25 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: A big help for nausea joyner1963 joyner1963
